item.description: K-means Clustering vs Mixtures of Gaussians K-means clustering Mixture of Gaussians EM Algorithm The general EM algorithm A different view of the EM algorithm, related to variational inference For the pdf slides, click here K-means Clustering vs Mixtures of Gaussians K-means clustering K-means clustering: problem Data \(D\)-dimensional observations: \(\mathbf{x}_1, \ldots, \mathbf{x}_N\) Parameters \(K\) clustersâ€™ means: \(\boldsymbol\mu_1, \ldots, \boldsymbol\mu_K\) Binary indicator \(r_{nk} \in \{0, 1\}\): if object \(n\) is in class \(k\) Goal: find values for \(\{\boldsymbol\mu_k\}\) and \(\{r_{nk}\}\) to minimize the objective function (called a distortion measure) \[ J = \sum_{n=1}^N \sum_{k = 1}^K r_{nk} \|\mathbf{x}_n - \boldsymbol\mu_k \|^2 \]
